intro: Roscoea auriculata, commonly known as the golden orchid or auriculate roscoea, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and other tropical plants. The plant features striking, showy inflorescences with yellow-orange flowers that resemble orchids, hence its common name. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and often have a reddish tint on the underside. Roscoea auriculata is appreciated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in well-drained soil.
